tool_description: Multiple in-depth checks related to TLS configuration, certificates and other aspects of domain security configuration. The API can perform MTA-STS (RFC-8461) and SMTP TLS Reporting (RFC-8460) configuration validation. Checks use DNSSEC-validating resolvers and include these results in the diagnostics exposed in the results.
name: Service Security Monitoring and Validation
title: Service Security Monitoring and Validation

api_list.name: TLS Certificate and Chain Check
api_list.description: Evaluate the TLS configuration, TLS certificate and chain for an Internet-exposed service. The results include some key diagnostics, including cypher suites used and certificate metadata as well as remaining life of the certificate. The certificate and any chain returned by the remote service is passed to the caller in an easy-to-use JSON structure. This endpoint supports various protocols to interact with the probed service — plain TLS, PostgreSQL and STARTTLS for SMTP, POP and IMAP — so checks can be made on services besides typical web servers.

required_parameters.name: protocol
required_parameters.description: Protocol to use to interact with the remote service. Must be one of {{plain}} for straight TLS, {{postgres}} for emulating a PostgreSQL client or {{starttls}} to use STARTTLS along with POP, IMAP or SMTP depending on the protocol detected on the required endpoint.

required_parameters.name: destination
required_parameters.description: The hostname or IP address of the remote service to be probed.

required_parameters.name: port
required_parameters.description: The TCP port number where the remote service to be probed is listening at.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://service-security-monitoring-and-validation.p.rapidapi.com/tlscheck/plain/google.com:443"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "service-security-monitoring-and-validation.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: RFC-8460/RFC-8461 TLSRPT and MTA-STS domain validation
api_list.description: This endpoints validates the MTA-STS configuration of a domain name, optionally checking MX server support of STARTTLS and its certificates for compliance with the policy. A number of validations rules and checks are performed, with results returned in human-readable form suitable for display, within a JSON structure. TLSRPT configuration is also reviewed, to ensure that domain implementing MTA-STS are able to receive reports related to TLS session setup from compliant senders. All name resolution is done through DNSSEC-validating resolvers, with results indicating whether DNSSEC was available.

required_parameters.name: domain
required_parameters.description: The domain name to check. Must be a valid, resolvable domain name.

optional_parameters.name: starttls
optional_parameters.description: When this parameter is set to true, the endpoint will attempt STARTTLS on up to the 10 best MX servers for the domain name. The TLS session and certificates are validated for compliance with the publishes MTA-STS policy.
